brewery.brewery_description: Ardent Craft Ales is a brewery, taproom, and beer garden in the Scott's Addition neighborhood of Richmond, Virginia. We began as a co-op in a Richmond garage, a space where we sought to create innovative beers and introduce others to historic brewing methods and beer styles. As a production brewery, our mission remains the same: to produce and celebrate exceptional and ambitious beers with the ever-growing craft beer community.

beer.beer_description:
*Bronze medal winner: 2018 Great American Beer Festival*

Ardent Pilsner is a golden straw, clear pilsner with classic lager aroma that is clean and bready, with light grassiness from 100% Hallertauer mittelfrÃ¼h noble hops. Medium body and high carbonation accentuate the soft bitterness, malty sweetness and mild fruitiness. Ardent Pilsner is a crisp, refreshing German-style pils that finishes dry and clean with a creamy, long-lasting head that leaves rich lacing. #neverstoplagering

Available on draft and in 4-packs of 16 oz. cans!

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 2)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 3!

beer.beer_description: Our Dark Rye, a dry, rye-based American imperial stout, aged in rum barrels.
Our Festbier is a traditional German lager with a malty backbone and light hoppiness. Amber color and full body in the classic Marzen style, served in 1/2 liter mugs. Prost!

user.bio: I tell it like it is, I'm immune to the hype.

beer.beer_description:
IPA X is double dry hopped with Citra and Mosaic hops, an exciting combination that provides big citrus and tropical fruit notes in both aroma and flavor. This juicy beer pours a cloudy, deep golden color, with super low bitterness and a silky soft mouthfeel.

Weâ€™re thrilled to introduce our newest core brand to the Ardent lineup: IPA X! Our brewers have experimented with different recipes, processes, hops and more between our rotational IPA and Hazy IPA batches over the past four years, all of which have culminated in our newest beer.

Look for IPA X on draft and in cans in the Ardent taproom and throughout Virginia!

items.checkin_comment: Nice balance of fruit and hops.

beer.beer_description: Our IPA is a medium copper-colored ale. We use a standard malt-backboned recipe, but as we rotate our hop varietals, the aroma may range from citrusy and piney to flowery and grassy. The beer is medium-bodied, and although the aroma always dominates the overall character of the beer, the sweetness of the caramel malt balances the hoppy bitterness. An American IPA that privileges hop flavor and aroma over bitterness.

Honey Ginger is a deep gold-colored ale, with medium/high carbonation that enhances the fresh ginger aroma. The malt backbone supports the sweetness of the locally sourced honey and the spiciness of the ginger. A strong yet refreshing and deceptively smooth spiced ale.

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 4)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 5!

items.checkin_comment: Wonderful Octoberfest. Butter and malty but not overly so.

user.bio: I drink because I'm a writer.  Or is it I'm a writer because I drink? Regardless I love beer so, yeah.

items.badge_description: Are you crazy? Five different types of beer in one day? Hope you were just sampling.

beer.beer_description: Our saison is a pale gold-colored farmhouse-style ale. We use a traditional yeast strain and Continental hops that in combination imbue an aroma with a mild spiciness tempered with fruit. The beer is medium-bodied, with a slight acidity. It is effervescent and dry, with an edge of bitterness that balances the fruitiness of the aroma. A yeast-derived refreshing, spicy ale.

Honey Ginger is a deep gold-colored ale, with medium/high carbonation that enhances the fresh ginger aroma. The malt backbone supports the sweetness of the locally sourced honey and the spiciness of the ginger. A strong yet refreshing and deceptively smooth spiced ale.

Our IPA is a medium copper-colored ale. We use a standard malt-backboned recipe, but as we rotate our hop varietals, the aroma may range from citrusy and piney to flowery and grassy. The beer is medium-bodied, and although the aroma always dominates the overall character of the beer, the sweetness of the caramel malt balances the hoppy bitterness. An American IPA that privileges hop flavor and aroma over bitterness.

Dark Rye is an American imperial stout, deep black with a long-lasting tan head. A rye spiciness balanced by roasted notes comes forward in both aroma and flavor. Dark Rye is full-bodied with a dry chocolaty finish.

Sweet Potato and Sage is a dry, farmhouse-style saison. Earthy notes from the sweet potatoes are balanced by the fragrant aroma of fresh, local sage. This fall seasonal features a continental malt backbone and subtle hop presence in a well-rounded beer.

Our IPA is a medium copper-colored ale. We use a standard malt-backboned recipe with citra hops to emphasize citrusy, tropical notes of grapefruit, melon, and passion fruit. The beer is medium-bodied, and although the aroma always dominates the overall character of the beer, the sweetness of the caramel malt balances the hoppy bitterness. An American IPA that privileges hop flavor and aroma over bitterness.

The Virginia Common is a deep brown-colored hybrid ale-lager. We use Cluster hops, one of the only commonly available hop varieties with North American roots, which impart a light hop aroma. It has a lower ABV than our other beers, and a mid-level carbonation. It is light-bodied, which allows for the toast of the specialty malts to shine. A sessionable ale-lager hybrid that will satisfy almost any beer drinker.

Earl Grey Brown Ale starts with classic brown color and white, frothy head. The rich tea and citrus aromatics give way to easy-drinking mouthfeel and flavors of black tea and bergamot on top of a classic, malt-forward English brown ale. A light-bodied, mild brown ale with hints of Earl Grey tea.
This is a hazy IPA made in the New England style, triple-dry-hopped with Citra, Mosaic, Idaho 7, Vic Secret, and Loral hops. Low in bitterness and full of fruity, juicy aroma and flavor.

Ardent's IPL is a dry-hopped India pale lager. This beer offers big aromatics of tropical fruits and citrus from the Mosaic & Citra dry hop and pours a golden straw color. The medium body leads into tropical flavors with slight malt sweetness and herbal bitterness. Finishes clean, crisp, and light.

IPA X is double dry hopped with Citra and Mosaic hops, an exciting combination that provides big citrus and tropical fruit notes in both aroma and flavor. This juicy beer pours a cloudy, deep golden color, with super low bitterness and a silky soft mouthfeel.

Weâ€™re thrilled to introduce our newest core brand to the Ardent lineup: IPA X! Our brewers have experimented with different recipes, processes, hops and more between our rotational IPA and Hazy IPA batches over the past four years, all of which have culminated in our newest beer.

Look for IPA X on draft and in cans in the Ardent taproom and throughout Virginia!

Robust Porter is a dark brown, medium-bodied American ale with a roasted malt aroma, complex flavor and dry finish. Notes of chocolate and coffee from the malt bill and minimal hoppy bitterness round out this classic porter style.

Defenestrator is an annual collaboration brewed with our friends from The Cask CafÃ©. This ruby brown doppelbock has a malty aroma and mild fruity notes. Defenestratorâ€™s clean, full-bodied mouthfeel complements the nutty flavor with malty, bready sweetness that finishes crisp for an easy-drinking, mellow doppelbock.

The DIPA is like our New England IPAâ€™s bigger, badder siblingâ€”the same yeast and malt backbone, but in a brawnier, scaled-up version. This cloudy and deep golden-colored beer showcases the aromas and flavors of its hops: funky tropical fruit from the Mosaic, and piney earthiness from the Simcoe. A soft mouthfeel and incredibly low bitterness let these juicy hops shine.

Berliner Weisse is pale straw colored, cloudy, and effervescent, with a sour aroma that includes a lemony tartness. Light body and high carbonation complement the clean sour flavor with notes of lemon and citrus, and the low alcohol content allows a hint of the malt profile to shine through. In the tradition of the style, try it with a flavored syrup, made by King of Pops.

Our Rye Kolsch uses rye malt instead of wheat for this German pilsner-style ale. The malt, balanced with noble hops, adds a delicate spiciness and slight fruit note to this light alternative for the winter. The Rye Kolsch is light golden in color and drinks very easy.

Schwarzbier is a sessionable dark German lager with a slightly chocolaty, roasted aroma. Medium bodied, with a crisp, clean mouthfeel. Subtle malt flavors are balanced by moderate hop bitterness, followed by a pleasantly roasty finish. Winner of the gold medal in the Darker European Beer category at the 2016 Virginia Craft Beer Cup.
This beer is a classic spiced pumpkin ale with a medium carbonation level that enhances the aroma and flavor of the roasted pumpkins and gourds.
The Ardent IPA, brewed with Columbus, Citra, and Mosaic hops.

Our Imperial Milk Stout is bold and rich, featuring notes of chocolate and residual sweetness from the addition of lactose, balanced by a roasty base. This big, dark stout is silky smooth, with none of the boozy burn you might expect from a 10% stout. Perfect for cooler weather and longer nights.

The Berliner Braunbier is our take on an all-but-extinct Northern German sour beer. The Braunbierâ€™s aroma has notes of stone fruit balanced by the slightly tart but still toasty malt backbone. Low in bitterness and light in body, it is effervescent with a clean finish. A low alcohol and mildly tart brown table beer.

*Bronze medal winner: 2018 Great American Beer Festival*

Ardent Pilsner is a golden straw, clear pilsner with classic lager aroma that is clean and bready, with light grassiness from 100% Hallertauer mittelfrÃ¼h noble hops. Medium body and high carbonation accentuate the soft bitterness, malty sweetness and mild fruitiness. Ardent Pilsner is a crisp, refreshing German-style pils that finishes dry and clean with a creamy, long-lasting head that leaves rich lacing. #neverstoplagering

Available on draft and in 4-packs of 16 oz. cans!
The Ardent IPA, brewed with Columbus and Centennial hops.

We fermented the Brett Saison with our house saison yeast, and then bottled it with two types of brettanomyces. The resulting beer is a golden straw color, hazy from bottle conditioning. Its effervescent mouthfeel emphasizes complex aromas and flavors: earthy, fruity, farmhouse funk, with a hint of saison pepperiness and a dry finish. Ages well, so try storing it for anywhere from a few months to a couple years.

Batch 100 is a SMaSH (single-malt and single-hop) English-style pale ale. Showcasing the classic English malt Maris Otter and a newer American hop varietal, Equinox, Batch 100 has a nice biscuity and slightly nutty malt character that is complemented by the citrusy, floral, and herbal notes from the Equinox hops. A slight hint of green pepper is also present in this thirst-quenching pale ale.
